availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Organized at Camp King in Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky. Mustered into service on January 2, 1862. Mustered out of service on December 27, 1865. Commander(s): Colonel Marcellus Mundy, Lieutenant Colonel J. P. Jackson, Lieutenant Colonel James C. Foy, and Lieutenant Colonel George W. Northup.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), p. 130-1, 163.
Frederick H. Dyer, A Compendium of the War of the Rebellion, (Des Moines: Dyer Publishing Company, 1908), p. 1207.
